intro: Glenniea zeylanica var. unijuga, commonly known as the single-lobed glenniea, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
